hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
#Set the below parameters manually package_name="ceilometer" published_version="2.9.0"
#Check distro and available version in repo : rhel7.x, Sles11.x/12.x, Ub16.x/17.x . /etc/os-release if [ $ID == "rhel" ]; then available_version=$(sudo yum info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "sles" ]; then available_version=$(sudo zypper info $package_name | grep Version | head -1 | cut -d ':' -f 2| cut -d ' ' -f 2) elif [ $ID == "ubuntu" ]; then available_version=$(sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-cache policy $package_name | grep Candidate | head -1 | cut -d ' ' -f 4) fi
if [[ $available_version == *"$published_version"* ]]; then echo "Version $published_version is already available in repo" echo "Exact name: $available_version ... Failing" exit 1 else echo "Published version is not available in repo. Going ahead." fi
export sourcedir=`pwd`
#Install the dependencies sudo apt-get update -y sudo apt-get install -y git python-dev findutils gcc python-setuptools python-dev build-essential libssl-dev libffi-dev
#Install pip using easy_install sudo easy_install pip
# Install pbr using pip sudo pip install pbr virtualenv cryptography
#Download the version 2.9.0 of Python-Ceilometerclient git clone git://github.com/openstack/python-ceilometerclient.git cd python-ceilometerclient git checkout 2.9.0
#Install tests related dependencies sudo pip install -r requirements.txt && sudo pip install -r test-requirements.txt
python setup.py test
echo "All tests passed"
# Install Ceilometer-client using the setup file sudo python setup.py install echo "Installation Successful"
ceilometer --help
